decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.

The design and materials for the proposed dormers are to match the existing dormers in the surrounding dwellings in St James Drive and Oaklands House, being 'proprietary GRP dormers', that were developed as part of a previous master planned housing development under Planning Permission P0525.07.
To maintain the established character and design of the master planned estate area.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with Abdul via email. The revisions involved removal of the two front dormers and replacement with only one front dormer with a reduced width and a change of materials. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 13 March 2020 and 18 March 2020.
description: Conversion of roof space to habitable use to include two front and two rear dormers.
